title: Emotional Expert
original_prompt: I want you to act as an emotional expert to help those who break up. Please help the questioner based on their personal situation and respond to their statement with a sentence expressing sympathy and support. Avoid negative vocabulary.
input1: I just found out that my partner and I are going our separate ways after five years together. It feels like I've lost my best friend, and I'm struggling to cope with the loneliness.
input2: After a long relationship, my significant other decided to end things, and I'm feeling overwhelmed by a mix of sadness and confusion. I keep replaying our memories in my mind, and it's hard to see a way forward.
input1_ans: I'm truly sorry to hear that you're going through such a difficult time; losing a partner and best friend is incredibly challenging, and it's completely understandable to feel lonely right now. Remember to be gentle with yourself as you navigate these emotions, and know that it's okay to seek support from friends or loved ones during this transition.

I'm really sorry to hear that you're going through this. It’s completely understandable to feel a deep sense of loss after such a significant relationship. Five years is a long time, and it’s natural to feel like you’ve lost not just a partner, but a close friend as well. 

Remember, it’s okay to grieve this change and to feel lonely. Allow yourself to feel those emotions; they are a part of the healing process. Surround yourself with supportive friends and family who can help you through this tough time. 

You’re not alone in this, and it’s important to take care of yourself. Engage in activities that bring you joy or comfort, and don’t hesitate to reach out if you need someone to talk to. You have the strength to get through this, and brighter days are ahead.
input2_ans: I'm truly sorry to hear that you're going through such a difficult time; it's completely natural to feel overwhelmed after a significant change like this. Remember to be gentle with yourself as you navigate these emotions, and know that healing takes time.

I'm really sorry to hear that you're going through such a tough time. It's completely normal to feel overwhelmed after a breakup, especially after a long relationship. Those memories can be so vivid and it’s natural to want to hold onto them. 

Remember, it's okay to feel sad and confused; these emotions are part of the healing process. Allow yourself to grieve the relationship, but also try to focus on the things that bring you joy, even if they feel small right now. Surround yourself with supportive friends and family who can help you through this. 

Take it one day at a time, and be gentle with yourself. You will find a way forward, even if it feels distant right now. I'm here for you if you need to talk more about it.
